68 
 
DEGREE AWARDING  
INSTITUTIONS  
DIRECT ENTRY  UTME    
UTME SUBJECTS  
ACTUARIAL SCIENCE  
CRAWFORD       
EDWIN CLARK  
JOS  
KWASU  
LAGOS           
REDEEMERS     
RHEMA  
  
ACTUARIAL SCIENCE AND  
INSURANCE  
AJAYI  
  
Two (2) ‘A’ level passes to 
include English Language 
and Mathematics.  
  
Five (5) SSC credit passes 
to include English 
Language, Mathematics 
and Economics plus any  
other two (2)   relevant 
subjects.  
  
Mathematics, 
Economics and one  
(1) other subject.   
  
DIRECT ENTRY  
(i) JOS – Same as in Marketing.  
(ii) LAGOS accepts very good passes in three (3) 
JUBEB/’A’ Level subjects: Mathematics and any 
two (2) of Financial Accounting, Geography, 
Government, Biology, Economics, Business 
Studies, Chemistry, Physics.  
(iii) ABU requires ‘A’ level Mathematics.  
  
  
UTME  
(i) JOS – Same as in Marketing  
(ii) LAGOS requires ‘O’ level credit passes in 
English Language, Mathematics, Economics, 
and any two (2) of Financial Accounting, Data 
Processing, CRS/IS, Further Mathematics,  
Geography, Government, Biology, Chemistry, 
Physics, Commerce, Civic Education,  
Insurance.  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) JOS – Same as in Marketing.  
(ii) LAGOS requires Mathematics, Economics and 
any one (1) of Geography, Government, 
Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Commerce.  
BUSINESS MANAGEMENT  
AUN (with options in Business  
Economics, Management)  
BSU        
 EBSU       
EPU  
EVANGEL  
FED-DUTSINMA  
Two (2) ‘A’ level passes 
chosen from Economics,  
Accounts, Business  
Management,  
Government, Geography 
or Statistics.  
  
Five (5) SSC credit passes 
including English  
Language, Mathematics,  
Economics, plus any two  
(2) of Accounting,  
Business Methods,  
Commerce,  
Government, Geography, 
and  
Statistics.  
Mathematics, 
Economics and one  
(1) other subject.  
  
DIRECT ENTRY  
(i) AAUA accepts ND upper credit in relevant 
programmes or HND lower credit plus the 
UTME requirements.  
(ii) AAUA requires 'A' level pass in Economics or 
Business Administration.  
(iii) ABU accepts two (2) 'A' Level/IJMB passes in 
Management/Social Science subjects, one of 
which must be in Economics.
